str2: And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From the alternate of proserchomai; an arriver from a foreign region, i.e., an acceder to Judaism.
A Cretan, an inhabitant of Crete. From Krete; a Cretan, i.e. Inhabitant of Crete.
An Arabian. From Arabia; an Arab or native of Arabia.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Grand, magnificent, splendid. From megas; magnificent, i.e. a conspicuous favor, or perfection.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 1st Person Plural
str2: Our, our own. From thnetos; our.
The tongue; by implication, a language.
